turn.text: (Inaudible)

turn.speaker: carol_mary_los
turn.label: Ms. Carol Mary Los
turn.text: If that is a test, Your Honor.
We don't feel at that particular time is a test.

turn.speaker: byron_r_white
turn.label: Justice Byron R. White
turn.text: What makes the custody of the car legal?

turn.speaker: carol_mary_los
turn.label: Ms. Carol Mary Los
turn.text: The car was taken Your Honor because it was suspected as being the escape vehicle.
Certainly, if someone would have come to claim the car the police officers could not have detained it.

turn.speaker: byron_r_white
turn.label: Justice Byron R. White
turn.text: The wife or brother or anybody else has showed up and take this car, just when they wanted to search it, they have to let it go.

turn.speaker: carol_mary_los
turn.label: Ms. Carol Mary Los
turn.text: You're right, Your Honor.
I would -- I would say --

turn.speaker: byron_r_white
turn.label: Justice Byron R. White
turn.text: Would you say that?

turn.speaker: carol_mary_los
turn.label: Ms. Carol Mary Los
turn.text: -- I'm saying that if they have searched the car --

turn.speaker: byron_r_white
turn.label: Justice Byron R. White
turn.text: They could search it and they could search it, I don't think they can hold the search?

turn.speaker: carol_mary_los
turn.label: Ms. Carol Mary Los
turn.text: If they had not begun search by the time members of the family had come to take the car, I would presume because of the time laps there, it could not be substantially contemporaneous with the arrest.
If they have the right to search the car, the right extends as I feel --

turn.speaker: byron_r_white
turn.label: Justice Byron R. White
turn.text: (Inaudible)

turn.speaker: carol_mary_los
turn.label: Ms. Carol Mary Los
turn.text: Well, Your Honor, we know.
I don't rely on that because I know that the witnesses could not specifically identify this particular automobile.

turn.speaker: hugo_l_black
turn.label: Justice Hugo L. Black
turn.text: But it was an automobile?

turn.speaker: carol_mary_los
turn.label: Ms. Carol Mary Los
turn.text: Excuse me, Your Honor?
Yes, Your Honor.

turn.speaker: hugo_l_black
turn.label: Justice Hugo L. Black
turn.text: You say it was the automobile, I think it was identified enough, wasn't it?

turn.speaker: carol_mary_los
turn.label: Ms. Carol Mary Los
turn.text: Well, yes it was, but as far as seizing it for purposes of evidence, in other words, having at been identified by someone as being the getaway car we could not do that because we know.

turn.speaker: hugo_l_black
turn.label: Justice Hugo L. Black
turn.text: Whose car was it?

turn.speaker: carol_mary_los
turn.label: Ms. Carol Mary Los
turn.text: It belonged to Raymond Lawson who was a co-defendant and he was driving the automobile.

turn.speaker: warren_e_burger
turn.label: Chief Justice Warren E. Burger
turn.text: Your time is up Ms. Los.
But I have one question for you.

Neither you nor your friend seemed to cite the Harris or Harrison case out of the District of Colombia Circuit which at least a great many people read as considerable clarification of the Preston doctrine where the automobile was searched by the police without a warrant substantially after the time of the arrest and several miles away.
Are you familiar with the case?

turn.speaker: carol_mary_los
turn.label: Ms. Carol Mary Los
turn.text: I am Your Honor, unfortunately, it does escape me at the moment.
I know that we did consider it we chose to rely on Dento which the circuit relied upon.

turn.speaker: warren_e_burger
turn.label: Chief Justice Warren E. Burger
turn.text: I just wondered if there where any reason to think that it was not in the point as I sat on the case in the Court of Appeals and my recollection is that it's very much in point here.
Perhaps Mr. Grogan will shed some light on it if he wishes to.

turn.speaker: vincent_j_grogan
turn.label: Mr. Vincent J. Grogan
turn.text: Your Honor, we also considered it.
I frankly at this point don't recall what our reasons where when we prepared the brief for not including it.
If I may, there was one thing I would like to call to the Court's attention.

In connection with the waiver of the argument on the infectiveness of counsel, I think the case of Fay against Noia decided by this Court would have to indicate that there have been a knowing waiver and here counsel made this gratuitous statement in the course of the discussion and it was not participated in by the defendant in any fashion.

turn.speaker: warren_e_burger
turn.label: Chief Justice Warren E. Burger
turn.text: You have a substantial amount of time left if you wish for a rebuttal.

turn.speaker: byron_r_white
turn.label: Justice Byron R. White
turn.text: Oh, he's out.

turn.speaker: warren_e_burger
turn.label: Chief Justice Warren E. Burger
turn.text: Oh!

turn.speaker: vincent_j_grogan
turn.label: Mr. Vincent J. Grogan
turn.text: I'm out of time.

turn.speaker: warren_e_burger
turn.label: Chief Justice Warren E. Burger
turn.text: Excuse me, I'm looking at the wrong sheet and the wrong case and it showed nine minutes but I was mistaken.

turn.speaker: vincent_j_grogan
turn.label: Mr. Vincent J. Grogan
turn.text: Thank you very much.

turn.speaker: warren_e_burger
turn.label: Chief Justice Warren E. Burger
turn.text: Thank you.
Thank you for your submission and for yours.
The case is submitted.

turn.speaker: carol_mary_los
turn.label: Ms. Carol Mary Los
turn.text: Thank you, sir.
